intro: Hieracium jaceoides, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium jaceoides is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
